text: Song Zhaolin (; 1928 - 7 June 2011) was a Chinese translator. He was most notable for being one of the main translators into Chinese of the novels of Jane Eyre, A Tale of Two Cities and David Copperfield. ==Biography== Song was born in Jinhua, Zhejiang, in 1928. In 1953 he graduated from Zhejiang University, where he majored in English language and literature. He started to publish works in 1950. In 1984 he joined the China Writers Association. He was a member of the Communist Party of China (CPC). On June 7, 2011, he died at the age of 83. ==Personal life== Song had three sons. ==Translations== * * * * ==References== Category:1928 births Category:People from Jinhua Category:2011 deaths Category:Zhejiang University alumni Category:English–Chinese translators
